newsitem.title: USA: MOTOR RACING-PRUETT TAKES PROVISIONAL POLE.
newsitem.headline: MOTOR RACING-PRUETT TAKES PROVISIONAL POLE.

text.p: Scott Pruett won the provisional pole for Sunday's Detroit Grand Prix Indy Car race on Friday after crashing and wiping out his primary car in the morning.

Pruett's crew had to put his Reynard Ford back together like a jig-saw puzzle to get him back on the track, where he broke the track record set by Nigel Mansell in 1994 by posting a lap of one minute, 9.572 seconds (108.664 mph/174.873 kph).
"We got into some oil, wiping out the left rear of the car," Pruett said about his first mishap of the day. He then tried his back-up car, but the transmission broke.

For the afternoon session, his team cannibalized the two cars. "We had two dead soldiers and had to make one good one out of two dead ones," he explained. "The team busted their butts to put a car together just to get car on the track."
Second fastest in a Reynard Mercedes-Benz was Canadian Greg Moore, winner of last week's race in Milwaukee. Third fastest was Mauricio Gugelmin of Brazil.
Teammates Michael Andretti and Roberto Moreno of Brazil were fourth and fifth fastest in Swift-Fords.
Final qualifying for the event, the eighth in the 17-race series, is scheduled for Saturday.
